pageContent: Background and purpose: The Sexual Adjustment Questionnaire (SAQ) is used in National Cancer Institute-sponsored clinical trials as an outcome measure for sexual functioning. The tool was revised to meet the needs for a clinically useful, theory-based outcome measure for use in both research and clinical settings. This report describes the modifications and validity testing of the modified Sexual Adjustment Questionnaire-Male (mSAQ-Male).
